comments.body: Holy cow this is an amazing idea for Minecraft for the Smithing table and fletching tables! This really should be added and/or considered.
I would like to add that maybe have the longbow able to knockback more.
Maybe you could also dye the hilt of a sword or that gray part on the bow with leather and a dye
This should go well with the new upgrade function of the smithing table. Maybe they have to add an extra window for the different types of upgrades/customization.

i liked the idea of smithing and fletching tables being used to upgrade weapons, this idea was kinda that implemented in the newest snapshot(20w10a), where it's now used to upgrade diamond gear to netherite, i guess it could be used to upgrade other weapons, tools and armor by adding a material, like adding string to a weapon or tool to increase it's durability, iron ingot(or iron block) to increase it's damage, we could add the same material more than 1 time, just like it's done to maps in cartographer table, but we can only add the same item which we added first to a weapon to increase it's stats.

I like this idea! I think that crossbows could have an upgrade to the firework feature where the arrow explodes on impact and has a circle of damage. Bows could also have an upgrade as a bow and teather from Grian's 7 features I'd love to see in Minecraft. While I personally don't agree with the non-leather-dying I really think this is an amazing idea that could have lot's of possibilities!

I like this idea, however I specifically want to see 'vertical brick' patterns for gray and terracotta because lots of cultures around the world use clay tile roofing and I would love to be able to replicate that!  (Why didn't this happen for desert villages)? Plus a vertical brick would help break up some of the designs and let us create more unique patterns.  This would give a lot more functionality to colored terracotta besides it being smelted right away into glazed terracotta.

It would be nice if the terracotta had more vibrant colors too.  Here are some concepts. (Credits to Systemzee and his team)  Also I think Minecraft should add this brick model for other stones as well as terracotta
This would be good for building in the mesa (I am an old minecraft player and will call it the mesa).
I was just trying to build my subway and that would be so helpful for every build
I was just trying to build my subway and that would be so helpful for every build!
When it comes to design the Origin Realms server has a really cool terracota brick design.

A block with colorful bricks is a very nice idea ! :) 
yellow and red blue and Light green and Light Blue bricks ...

I like the idea of "moss", but I think it would be better if it was an overlay texture like vines, but it spread to any of the adjacent six directions and on any exposed block face.

Aesthetically you could see a couple of patches of the underlying block through it perhaps an edge, but the rest would be covered

Put an "age" limit on it like kelp has (so that it will eventually stop spreading)

Have it only spawn in specific biomes and variations for different biomes; forest would be normal, nether would be red, swamp would be a slime green, mushroom would be grey, oceans would be blue, caves would be phosphorescent yellow.

Maybe the swamp variant could grow on top of water sources too.

Have some blocks that moss wouldn't grow over. (non-solid blocks, ice, quartz?)

Have it reduce fall damage by 1/2 heart

Harvest only with sheers and use it to brew healing draughts.

It breaks with one hit or when it's grown over water and you walk over it (does not drop when it breaks)

I like the spreading idea. I think we already have a huge number of options for wood blocks, so I'm not sure if we need a dedicated mossy variant. I'm wondering if we can modify the texture file of the moss block and moss carpets so that they try to mimic the shade of grass that would occur in that same biome. Not a new type of moss per biome shade as that would get ridiculous, but just a color pallete alteration like grass or leaves already get.
I agree for this because it's been in java edition since 1.13 and bedrock edition doesnt have it yet :(
Please, Mojang, this limits creativity for bedrock players.

I’m with ya

Its so annoying 

- GamerPip2020
And also berry cake too.  for that to be a different cake, color, texture, and flavor.
And chocolate cakes made with cocoa
ooo that sounds good..
You should have to sneak to place a water bucket
Me haz robado la idea, es algo lo cual me emcantaria
Also, buckets can be hung from the celling like lanterns.
We need something like this!
I like the idea of using crying obsidian, although not the menu as much
There could be an XP Totem that, when used, transfers XP into it, filling a bar. XP Bottles could work the same way
Crying Obsidian with XP should have XP colors and drip XP
There is really no point to do this because you can already get tons of exp easily from endermen,blazes and mob spawner farms.
I've been needing this in some of my survival worlds because i'll die with a bunch of XP. This would be so useful.

this is for the person who said this isn't necessary: Ok sure, this might be slightly unessecary because of the steps taken to do it, but it could still be a really helpful addition to the game. for example: you just got done farming exp from a farm of some sort, and then you think, "im going to go enchant my items after i check my crops." but its nighttime, and as you harvest your plants, you get attacked by a mob and die, losing all of the levels you just got. What should have you done? bottled your xp and stored it in a chest so you can use it when you actually need. because carrying xp is basicly always putting your levels at risk. im not telling you that your opinion is wrong, im just trying to show you a way that this method can be used effectively.
An automatic version/xp hopper would be great too, because you could set up an entity cramming auto mob farm with a chunk loader for free xp
I agree! With the new glowsquid and glow lichen, there should be a way to throw a glow lichen up high onto walls.

I ran out of space for the possible uses, so here's one: 

Emergency supply of giving your friends potions in a wither fight gone wrong.

 

Also the bundle arrow could be fired by being in your secondary hand or first in your inventory compared to regular arrows. This is basically how firing potion-tipped arrows works.

It would also give a really good use to the fletching table (if it ends up having an interface like a smithing table) where you could combine the arrow and a bundle. (Also it is very odd that two people had this very specific idea isn't it)

Make that three haha, the ability to easily move items a bit further is really appealing, theres a lot of multiplayer use but also: i think letting the player aim to their base to quickly drop off a few items could be great. I like the idea of adding a use to fletching tables but i think letting players quickly make these in their crafting grid would be ideal.
glowing ink as something to craft a glowing leather armor will be perfect

I think this is a great idea. i am always trying to make things and find the half slabs to be too thick and the carpet or pressure plates too thin and that they dont look right

examples

countertops

tables

I think this should be added to Minecraft 1.22 or later for a few reasons:

  1. Since we have full blocks, 3/4th blocks(stairs), and 1/2 blocks(slabs), it's only fitting that we finish these off with a 1/4th block since it feels empty without one.
  2. As someone already said, the slabs can feel too big sometimes, and it would be helpful for more detailed builds.
  3. It could be used to make thinner walls by stacking them on top of each other like you can do with slabs.
Pokemon?
Eso es muy buena idea
Thank you!
can you add a crafting recipe and an activation structure please? I think the idea has future and is cool.

Bending physics? This definitely won't have bugs/issues/exploits!
"Its not a issue, its a feature!" -Abraham Lincoln
I do like this idea though, what if the void beacon is upside down, and has to have a clear path to the void instead of the sky? And not just a pyramid, that wouldn't be original.
That's a big jump
L is 50 if that’s what you need but that is totally unnecessary in my opinion
Awesome idea!  But  if it is getting tHat brigHt for a mob sneak attak could be blinding. I tHink tHis is a great idea for minecraft dungeons. (:
Good idea for looks, don't think we need any new food though. Maybe it could be used as fuel or to make some kind of existing dye.
This would have no use other than pvp or griefing so it would most likely not be used often by most players
No. Enchanted crossbows are op
Lavenders need to be added then
totems of undying are NOT cheap. Therefore, the crafting recipe could be 8 coral (of the desired type) around 1 totem of undying to get 10 to 12 coral that does not die.
It should attract magnetic subtances and on the other end push them away. Could also affect when player is using iron armor for example.
Not a Nether Star, a Lightning Rod.
TNT arrows and lightning arrows
A nice way of passively farming dye, I like it
Presumably the flowers could be turned into dye?  That would make a nice source of dye as long as it was just for 4 colors.
Let’s vote!

I think it should take the helmet slots over and use a lingering potion, it should break overtime as well, but the pendant turns back into the 8 leather and the specific colored glass pane, healing and harming should not work with this, as that would be OP.
The potion effect would run out after a while, and it wouldn't be as strong as if you had drank it.
